channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023091010
item.description:
Report X-2023091010

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023090985
item.description:
Report X-2023090985

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLERS WERE LOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND HAD A STRONG ODOR. THEY INFORMED THE MANAGER OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND FOUND THE PACKAGE AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE HAD NO HAZMAT LABEL ON THE OUTSIDE AND PLACED IT IN THE TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG. ONCE IT WAS CONTAINED, THEY BROUGHT IT BACK AND PLACED IN THE VENTILATOR. DescribePack: FIVE OF THE BOTTLES ARE CRUSHED IN THE SIDE FROM BEING DROPPED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023090819
item.description:
Report X-2023090819

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT BOXES WAS UNLOADED FROM A TRUCK IN THE DMP. ONE OF THE BOXES ON THE PALET WAS LEAKING. THE BOX HAD SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABEL. UPON CLEAN UP RESPONDER FOUND THE BOX HAD 4 BOTTLES INSIDE THAT HAD CAPS THAT WERE LOOSE. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE BOX BY PLACING IT IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND BEGINNING THE PROCESS OF DISPOSING OF IT PROPERLY THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023090809
item.description:
Report X-2023090809

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKER AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THAT ONE 5 GALLON PLASTIC BUCKET HAD A SMALL CRACK IN THE TOP. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.

Report X-2023090923

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed upside down in trailer forcing liquid through the lid. Package was discovered in the unload and was placed in a plastic lined tote. DescribePack: Liquid leaked through the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a plastic lined tote and placed in the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report I-2023090034
item.description:
Report I-2023090034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRUGREEN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. A TruGreen employee was performing an application of product at a residential location when a hose malfunction occurred resulting in the release of approximately 30 gallons of an insecticide, fungicide, pesticide and miticide solution. The free product impacted concrete and a storm drain at the loss location. Clean Harbors Environmental Service was dispatched to perform the cleanup at the loss location. Telephonic regulatory reports were made to the national Response Center. The Kansas Department of Health and Environment, and the Harvey County LEPC. There were no injuries or exposures reported in connection with the release.

item.title: Report I-2023090025
item.description:
Report I-2023090025

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: HUGOTON
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WILBUR-ELLIS COMPANY LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While traveling, driver stopped short, which caused one 265 gallon tote to fall and release approximately 99 gallons of free liquid to the roadside soil. Free product was contained to immediate area and did not migrate or threaten to impact state waters. LoneStar Hazmat Response was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, LoneStar Hazmat Response deployed absorbent boom to the affected area, due to rainfall, and secured the area pending return for excavation. Lone Star Hazmat returned the following day, excavated the impacted soil, and restored site to preexisting condition. Approximately 12.93 tons of contaminated soil were recovered and transported to Southwest Landfill of Canyon, Texas for disposal. There were no injuries or exposures reported.
